If not treated well on time, chronic dehydration could be fatal. Dehydration disrupts [metabolic](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/5-morning-drinks-to-kickstart-your-metabolism-1681019)processes and can affect all organs of the body. You may not get enough time to keep yourself [hydrated](https://food.ndtv.com/health/quench-your-thirst-with-these-hydrating-foods-756061), but considering the health hazards dehydration may have on your body, you must look at curing it immediately.According to our [Ayurveda](https://food.ndtv.com/health/5-of-ayurvedas-best-kept-secrets-for-great-health-fitness-glowing-skin-1664281)Expert MA Choudhary from AyurTree Herbal, drinking water can certainly prevent dehydration. It is one of the most effective remedies. Certain herbs can help too in treating dehydration. Here are some of the most effective [herbs](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/10-dried-herbs-you-must-have-in-your-kitchen-cupboard-1439762) that will help you deal with dehydration: 1. Chamomile [Chamomile](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/13-incredible-chamomile-tea-benefits-drink-up-1629069)is considered as a great re-hydrating agent, along with being an analgesic and de- [stressing](https://food.ndtv.com/health/6-expert-tips-to-overcome-mental-stress-at-work-1418359)herb. It also comes as a de-caffeinated tea option that further helps you keep hydrated by replacing the fluids lost due to dehydration. Take about two to three dried chamomile flowers (or tea) in a cup of hot water and let it soak for 10 minutes before straining it. Have two to three cups of chamomile tea every day.(Also Read: [8 Ayurvedic Tips To Keep Cool In Summer; Healthy!](https://food.ndtv.com/health/8-ayurvedic-tips-to-keep-cool-in-summer-stay-healthy-1821738)) Chamomile is considered a great rehydrating agent2. ElderflowerElderflower helps in reducing the body temperature and lessen the need of expelling heat from the body through evaporation. When evaporation comes down, fluid retention automatically goes up. Take elderflowers and crush them in to fine powder. Consume one-two teaspoons of this powder with water at least two times every day. You can also make a herbal tea and consume it daily for better results. Elderflower helps reducing the body temperature3.Asparagus [Asparagus](https://food.ndtv.com/health/6-incredible-benefits-of-asparagus-the-nutrient-powerhouse-1649301)helps the body to retain fluids, thereby preventing dehydration. It is super rich in [fiber](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/5-fiber-rich-foods-you-should-be-eating-everyday-1201686)that stimulates absorption of water in the body. It also cools down your body temperature in this heat. You can use asparagus in various [salads](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/power-salads-5-ways-to-transform-dinner-1407451)and vegetables or consume in the form of tea, supplements, etc.(Also Read: [7 Foods You Must Have Regularly to Avoid Dehydration in Summers](https://food.ndtv.com/food-drinks/7-foods-you-must-have-regularly-to-avoid-dehydration-in-summers-1703772)) You can use asparagus in various salads and vegetables4. Willow BarkOne of the most sought after and recommended herbal remedy is willow bark. The inner bark of the willow tree is believed to have medicinal properties and is used to cure acute [headaches](https://food.ndtv.com/health/10-natural-home-remedies-for-headaches-that-actually-work-1215616)caused by dehydration. It has cooling properties that help in keeping the body temperature low. It also helps reduce cramps in the stomach, [pain](https://food.ndtv.com/health/7-home-remedies-for-period-pain-1623302)and inflammation. You can consume it in the form of tincture, herbal tea or even supplements.5. Licorice (Mulethi)Licorice or mulethi is a favoured herb in Indian households and is used in several ways. It can be consumed in the form of a decoction, further keeping the body cool and hydrated. Although these herbs have positive effects on your body, it is recommended to consult your doctor or health expert before consuming them. The effects may vary based on the severity of dehydration.
